attributes.action: Review the pay deal for nurses and therefore show that Mr Blair really is resolute in wanting a Strong and Dependable NHS in the UK - Help us to prove we have The best Healthcare in the World
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear reader, many thanks for taking time to read this.

I have been nursing for 17 years and whilst a person does not enter into the 
profession of nursing for the monetary rewards, isn’t it reasonable to expect to 
receive a moderate wage with pay rewards that are at least in line with the 
rate of inflation?

Many would agree that we enter into this profession because we want to make a difference to the lives of those people that we come into contact with. It is the right of patients to receive whole-hearted, compassionate and conscientious care not only on an individual basis but for their families and carers also. 
On a personal basis, my care does not stop when my shift does. I have never 
put my excess hours down as overtime, neither have I asked for remuneration 
in any way from our glorious NHS. Isn’t it therefore reasonable to ask for a 
fair wage increase?

If you agree, I ask for your support by adding your name to this growing 
list, and once again thank you for your time.
